line-7: At Network Rail, we’re part of a large family serving millions of passengers and freight users throughout the UK every day. Our service impacts millions of people and we strive to become more efficient as we enhance, maintain and operate our network.Our passengers and freight users are at the heart of everything we do. We help connect people to their friends and families and get goods to their destination safely and efficiently. We’re an organisation where people matter. When you're part of our team, you matter to us and you matter to millions. Watch our video to find out more!The Wales & Western region includes more than 2,700 miles of railway and we serve communities and businesses of Wales, the Thames Valley, West of England and the Southwest Peninsula. Our ambition to be responsive to passengers and freight users drives us every day and we're empowered to do the right thing for those who use the rail network. We actively challenge unsafe practices and take responsibility for addressing risks, resolving issues and protecting safety and wellbeing.About our people and the recruitment process - We’re an inclusive employer of choice and we welcome applications from everyone! As a Network Rail employee, you will enjoy a wide range of benefits! · Privileged staff travel - Leisure travel discount of 75% on all leisure travel and includes family members. · A subsidy of up to 75% on rail and underground season tickets if you travel to work on the train.· Benefits package including healthcare offers, a cycle to work scheme, discounted healthcare club membership, and a discounted offers and benefits including childcare, healthcare and online shopping site.· Effectively manage work-life balance with a 35hrs per week contract, hybrid working, flexible working, and enhanced family friendly support.· 5 days paid volunteering leave.· 2 weeks paid reserve leave for the Armed Forces community.· In Wales and Western region, you will have the opportunity to join PROUD, our reward and recognition scheme where you can say thanks and recognise colleagues across the region who have demonstrated outstanding values and behaviours.To find out more about the benefits at Network Rail, click here.We want to help deliver a railway which is safe, reliable, affordable and that provides great customer service to everyone. line-9: The Wales & Western Capital Delivery team believe in the ‘One Team’ ethos. You will be working in a team that is passionate about delivering safely, efficiently and providing value for money for our passengers, train and freight operators and the taxpayer. We are embarking on an exciting delivery model for Control Period 7. Our portfolio is diverse spanning from Buildings & Civils, Enhancements, Track, Signalling, Power and Communications. The projects delivered can range from major enhancements e.g., HS2 Old Oak Common Station on the Great Western Mainline to medium sized enhancements, third party funded projects, renewals and minor works. All of these are key to keeping our railway safe and running. Our focus is on recruiting and retaining people who are key to the running of our railway. We are committed to supporting learning and development and enabling individuals to bring their whole selves to work. We are passionate about diversity and inclusion and have evidenced that a diverse team has enabled better delivery. The location can be Cardiff or Bristol. Please see document attached to this vacancy for more information on what it’s like to work in the Commercial Function of Wales & Western region! line-11: You will manage commercial post contract activities required to meet business performance and efficiency targets. You will also provide pre-contract commercial support required to procure the contracts but not the procurement process itself. You will work collaboratively with stakeholders and manage key supplier relationships, identifying best practice and liaising as required to provide an efficient, cost effective and collaborative delivery of commercial activity therefore concluding the delivery of the current control period and setting control period 7 up for success. Robust commercial / contract management is both exciting and challenging but rewarding when contracts are delivered successfully, and you will play a key role in this. Your Main Responsibilities will be to:· Support the programme and project teams with Commercial compliance.· Commercial reporting of allocation project.· Flagging and mitigating issues found through reporting.· Monitor and actively influence decision makers and contractor’s commercial behaviours, delivery and activity.· Manage and challenge assessment and valuation of contractor’s applications and processing of payment certification.· Commercial advice on project changes.· Produce applications for payment/invoices to outside clients.· Identify and advise on all commercial risk/claim events.· Provide of ad-hoc management information and analysis to promote informed decision-making.· Produce and retain appropriate commercial correspondence and contractual notices for issue in accordance with contractual conditions.· Undertake final account settlements and internal reconciliation to project close-out.· Support demonstration of efficiencies and continual improvement of estimating by undertaking cost analysis of completed projects and feedback.· Support pre post contractual procurement activities as appropriate.· Provide support to estimating resources, offering guidance and advice on project scale/scope as required.· Support the negotiation of all prices under existing contracts/framework arrangements and participate in quantitative risk assessment and value management workshops.You will ideally have· Demonstrable experience in commercially managing investment projects· Good understanding of railway / construction industry forms of contract, or in relatable industry· Good understanding of the construction/railway industry, or relatable industry· Good negotiation skills What could set you apart· Educated to degree standard in related subject· Membership of a relevant professional institute, chartered status· Significant experience of working within a generalist commercial environment· Awareness of industry issuesNot sure if you meet all the requirements?
